item.title: Toshiba, Rohm to Invest $2.69 Billion in Power Device Venture
item.description: The companies said they will boost production capacity of silicon carbide and silicon power devices, components used for supplying and managing power in parts such as electric-vehicle powertrains.

item.title: Bond Rally Could Run Out of Steam
item.description: The bond rally will likely fade as central banks might start cutting rates later than some market pricing suggests, Societe Generale Research said.

item.title: Anglo American Warns on Output, to Cut Costs
item.description: Anglo American cautioned that production next year would fall around 4% due to near-term constraints and volatile market conditions, and said it planned to cut costs by $1 billion.

item.title: USD/JPY Likely to Extend Downtrend, Charts Show
item.description: USD/JPY is likely to extend its downtrend, based on technical charts, UOB’s Global Economics & Markets Research said, noting the currency pair’s plunge on Thursday.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.7%, Weighed by Stronger Yen, Weaker Economy
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average fell 1.7% to close at 32307.86, dragged by the yen’s strength, which hurts overseas earnings of Japanese exporters when repatriated to Japan.

item.title: India Central Bank Stands Pat as Higher Inflation Looms
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India kept its policy rate unchanged as expected, saying economic activity is strong but that volatile food prices could raise inflation.

item.title: The World's Most Anonymous CEO Is About to Take Center Stage
item.description: The founder of fast-fashion juggernaut Shein has managed to stay out of the spotlight despite his company’s meteoric rise. With an IPO looming, he likely won’t remain under the radar for much longer.

item.title: In One of the Least Diverse Nations, an American Outsider Shakes Up Politics
item.description: John Linton, born and raised in South Korea, tries to rejuvenate that country’s ruling party.

item.title: Palestinian Families Seek Medical Care Outside Besieged Gaza
item.description: Egypt and the U.A.E. are bringing out some of the injured and ill, but many families are separated and left behind.

item.title: Double Trouble: Investors Fight Fed on Two Fronts
item.description: While rate expectations have plunged for next year, further out they are still high.

item.title: The cost of hiring an au pair could double under a Biden administration proposal to set pay for foreign nannies using a formula that takes into account state and local minimum wages.
item.description: The cost of hiring an au pair could double under a Biden administration proposal to set pay for foreign nannies using a formula that takes into account state and local minimum wages.

item.title: Apple Aims to Make a Quarter of the World's iPhones in India
item.description: Supplier Foxconn plans to build more factories and give India a production role once limited mostly to China.

item.title: Investment giant Blackstone and Digital Realty are creating a new venture to develop $7 billion in data centers, as demand has soared.
item.description: Investment giant Blackstone and Digital Realty are creating a new venture to develop $7 billion in data centers, as demand has soared.

item.title: A former OpenAI board member who voted to fire co-founder Sam Altman said a lack of trust was the reason and the dismissal was consistent with the board's duty to ensure AI systems are built responsibly.
item.description: A former OpenAI board member who voted to fire co-founder Sam Altman said a lack of trust was the reason and the dismissal was consistent with the board’s duty to ensure AI systems are built responsibly.

item.title: Hunter Biden was indicted on nine tax charges, in a case that adds a new layer of legal peril for the president's son.
item.description: Hunter Biden was indicted on nine tax charges, in a case that adds a new layer of legal peril for the president’s son.

item.title: Chinese leader Xi and Europe's top officials sought to ease tensions over trade and economic disputes at their first in-person summit in Beijing.
item.description: Chinese leader Xi and Europe’s top officials sought to ease tensions over trade and economic disputes at their first in-person summit in Beijing.

item.title: The amount of money Institutional investors have in Chinese stocks and bonds has declined by more than $31 billion this year, through October, the biggest net outflow since China joined the WTO in 2001.
item.description: The amount of money Institutional investors have in Chinese stocks and bonds has declined by more than $31 billion this year, through October, the biggest net outflow since China joined the WTO in 2001.

item.title: Yellow rejected an offer to revive the bankrupt trucking company and rehire thousands of its former workers.
item.description: Yellow rejected an offer to revive the bankrupt trucking company and rehire thousands of its former workers.

item.title: Biden pledged to keep pressing for the release of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich days after his administration revealed that Russia rejected a new offer to gain his freedom.
item.description: Biden pledged to keep pressing for the release of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich days after his administration revealed that Russia rejected a new offer to gain his freedom.

item.title: Apple and its suppliers aim to build more than 50 million iPhones in India annually within the next two to three years, according to people involved.
item.description: Apple and its suppliers aim to build more than 50 million iPhones in India annually within the next two to three years, according to people involved.
